sentence.Network_en: A common misconception is that there is something inherently electrical about a watt or kilowatt.
sentence.Network_cn: 通常有一个错误的认识,以为瓦和千瓦是专门用在电上的.

sentence.Network_en: A one - kilowatt stand - alone PV system with UC as energy storage was developed.
sentence.Network_cn: 以超级电容器作为储能装置,进行了千瓦级独立光伏系统的研制.

sentence.Network_en: It cooked the remote - controlled aircraft using a somewhat feeble 1 - kilowatt beam.
sentence.Network_cn: 激光复仇者能用稍弱的1千瓦光速把远程控制的飞机烤焦.

entry.def: A kilowatt is a unit of power. One kilowatt is a thousand watts.

example.ex: ...a prototype system which produces 25 kilowatts of power.
example.tran: 功率为25千瓦的原型系统

means.word_mean: 1. a unit of power equal to 1000 watts

auth_sentence.content: The customer cares about their cost per kilowatt hour.
auth_sentence.res_content: The customer cares about their cost per kilowatt hour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The customer cares about their cost per kilowatt hour.

auth_sentence.content: Kilowatts measure power, kilowatt-hours measure energy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Kilowatts measure power, kilowatt-hours measure energy.

auth_sentence.content: The tariff for surplus electricity exported to the national grid will remain at 3.1p per kilowatt-hour.
auth_sentence.res_content: The tariff for surplus electricity exported to the national grid will remain at 3.1p per kilowatt-hour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The tariff for surplus electricity exported to the national grid will remain at 3.1p per kilowatt-hour.

Sentence.sentence: The residents are billed by "net metering": they pay for the amount of power they tap off the grid, less the kilowatts (千瓦) they feed into it.
